revised_title: Elephant Remains and Teeth from Cave Deposits in Cyprus
tldr: The author discusses the discovery of numerous fossilized elephant remains, specifically Elephas cypriotes, in cave deposits in Cyprus. They describe the geological context of the deposits and analyze the teeth and other bones found, comparing them to other known elephant species. This research provides valuable information about the extinct fauna and the geological history of Cyprus.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Paleobiology
